transcript_segments.content: Welcome to the course! In this first module, we're going to get you set up with R and RStudio. The core data structure you'll be working with is the data frame, which is like a table or spreadsheet inside your code.
To assign a value to a variable, we use the arrow operator, which is a less-than sign followed by a dash, like this: x <- 5. This is the standard convention in R.
Now we'll dive into data visualization using the powerful ggplot2 package. The key idea behind ggplot2 is the 'grammar of graphics', which allows you to build any plot layer by layer.

The most fundamental function for creating a scatter plot is geom_point(). You add this layer to your ggplot object to render the individual data points. Remember to define your x and y aesthetics inside the aes() function.
